Claim: Indian yoga guru Baba Ramdev has been infected with coronavirus.
Explaination: An old picture of Ramdev from the year 2011 is being shared with a false caption. The picture was taken in Dehradun after the yoga guru broke his nine-day fast. He had been on a hunger strike demanding tougher a law against corruption and seeking the return of black money stashed abroad.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Indian yoga guru Baba Ramdev has been infected with coronavirus.

Explanation:An old picture of Ramdev from the year 2011 is being shared with a false caption. The picture was taken in Dehradun after the yoga guru broke his nine-day fast. He had been on a hunger strike demanding tougher a law against corruption and seeking the return of black money stashed abroad.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/ramdev-infected-with-coronavirus-can-be-treated-using-cow-dung-cow-urine-fact-check

Claim: Corpses of coronavirus victims are scattered on a street in Wuhan, China.
Explaination: The photo was taken on March 24, 2014, depicting people who lied down on a pedestrian zone for an art project remembering the Katzbach Nazi concentration camp victims.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Corpses of coronavirus victims are scattered on a street in Wuhan, China.

Explanation:The photo was taken on March 24, 2014, depicting people who lied down on a pedestrian zone for an art project remembering the Katzbach Nazi concentration camp victims.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/251998-photo-coronavirus-infected-corpses-wuhan-china

Claim: First patient healed in Algeria.
Explaination: The man is from Morocco and appears in a TV ad for an hospital in Morocco.
Label: False
html:
Claim: First patient healed in Algeria.

Explanation:The man is from Morocco and appears in a TV ad for an hospital in Morocco.

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200310-intox-virales-afrique-autour-coronavirus-decryptees?check=1

Claim: While coronavirus tests in other countries are conducted for free or at nominal charges, in India, it costs Rs 4,500
Explaination:
In India, coronavirus tests are free in government labs. Private labs charge more in India, as well as in other countries
.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: While coronavirus tests in other countries are conducted for free or at nominal charges, in India, it costs Rs 4,500

Explanation:In India, coronavirus tests are free in government labs. Private labs charge more in India, as well as in other countries .

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-are-coronavirus-tests-most-expensive-in-india-1659724-2020-03-25

Claim: China seeks court approval to kill over 20,000 coronavirus patients to stop the spread of the outbreak.
Explaination: This unsubstantiated claim came from a website that published frequently false claims. There is no evidence that China went to courts looking for such approval. Claim was also debunked by several other outlets.
Label: False
html:
Claim: China seeks court approval to kill over 20,000 coronavirus patients to stop the spread of the outbreak.

Explanation:This unsubstantiated claim came from a website that published frequently false claims. There is no evidence that China went to courts looking for such approval. Claim was also debunked by several other outlets.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471622-fake-news-china-seek-for-courts-approval-to-kill-the-over-20000-coronavirus-patients-to-avoid-furthe.html

Claim: Chinese spies stole the coronavirus from a Canadian lab.
Explaination: Mix up with an investigation of Chinese scientist in Canada in 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chinese spies stole the coronavirus from a Canadian lab.

Explanation:Mix up with an investigation of Chinese scientist in Canada in 2019.

https://factcheck.afp.com/chinese-spies-did-not-steal-deadly-coronavirus-canada

Claim: No deaths have been reported in Israel due to COVID-19 because they have found a cure for the disease. A solution of hot water, baking soda and lemon is the cure for COVID-19.
Explaination: There have been 15 deaths in Israel due to COVID-19 plus the solution of lemon, hot water and bicarbonate is not proven to cure COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: No deaths have been reported in Israel due to COVID-19 because they have found a cure for the disease. A solution of hot water, baking soda and lemon is the cure for COVID-19.

Explanation:There have been 15 deaths in Israel due to COVID-19 plus the solution of lemon, hot water and bicarbonate is not proven to cure COVID-19.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/31/lemon-and-baking-soda-solution-cannot-cure-covid-19/

Claim: 5G technology caused the coronavirus.
Explaination: Historical events were conflated, and did not back up claims with real evidence.
Label: False
html:
Claim: 5G technology caused the coronavirus.

Explanation:Historical events were conflated, and did not back up claims with real evidence.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472004-fact-check-5g-technology-not-believed-to-have-caused-coronavirus.html

Claim: A large amount of sulfur dioxide was observed in Wuhan because up to 14,000 bodies were incinerated.
Explaination: The source of the information is "Windy.com", but even if the body was burned, "Windy.com" does not show real-time sulfur dioxide.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A large amount of sulfur dioxide was observed in Wuhan because up to 14,000 bodies were incinerated.

Explanation:The source of the information is "Windy.com", but even if the body was burned, "Windy.com" does not show real-time sulfur dioxide.

https://www.buzzfeed.com/jp/kotahatachi/unknown-cause-china-11
ann25_remarks: As the article is in Chinese I cannot read.  However, it is possible that Windy.com provided historical data, I am not certain how recent this data is published.

Claim: Vatican says Pope Francis has been infected with the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The Vatican said the pope recently fell ill with a common cold..
Label: False
html:
Claim: Vatican says Pope Francis has been infected with the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The Vatican said the pope recently fell ill with a common cold..

https://factcheck.afp.com/report-not-genuine-news-site-vatican-said-pope-was-suffering-cold

Claim: “There’s magically already a vaccine available.”
Explaination: Anthony S. Fauci, a top official at the National Institutes of Health (NIH), told Bloomberg Law that a potential vaccine "could move into early-stage human testing in the next three months."
Label: Not true
html:
Claim: “There’s magically already a vaccine available.”

Explanation:Anthony S. Fauci, a top official at the National Institutes of Health (NIH), told Bloomberg Law that a potential vaccine "could move into early-stage human testing in the next three months."

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471529-fake-news-patent-for-coronavirus-that-expired-is-not-for-new-strain-killing-people-in-china.html

Claim: Trupti Desai, a well known social activist from India, was arrested for illegally buying liquor during the COVID-19 lockdown.
Explaination: The video shown with the above claim is 7-months-old. Trupti Desai was detained by the Pune police after she threatened to offer a garland of liquor bottles to then CM Devendra Fadnavis.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Trupti Desai, a well known social activist from India, was arrested for illegally buying liquor during the COVID-19 lockdown.

Explanation:The video shown with the above claim is 7-months-old. Trupti Desai was detained by the Pune police after she threatened to offer a garland of liquor bottles to then CM Devendra Fadnavis.

https://marathi.factcrescendo.com/no-trupti-desai-was-not-arrested-during-lockdown/

Claim: The coronavirus has been “released” by China […] it was purposely propagated by the Chinese themselves.
Explaination: All available data indicate that SARS-CoV-2, the virus responsible for COVID-19, is of natural origin. Comparisons of viral genome sequences show that it shares a strong identity with similar coronaviruses that infect pangolins and bats. And further investigations of the SARS-CoV-2 genome suggest that the virus was not artificially created or propagated in laboratories. In the absence of evidence proving otherwise, the claim that SARS-CoV-2 was lab-created and intentionally released is not only unsubstantiated but also implausible.
Label: No evidence
html:
Claim: The coronavirus has been “released” by China […] it was purposely propagated by the Chinese themselves.

Explanation:All available data indicate that SARS-CoV-2, the virus responsible for COVID-19, is of natural origin. Comparisons of viral genome sequences show that it shares a strong identity with similar coronaviruses that infect pangolins and bats. And further investigations of the SARS-CoV-2 genome suggest that the virus was not artificially created or propagated in laboratories. In the absence of evidence proving otherwise, the claim that SARS-CoV-2 was lab-created and intentionally released is not only unsubstantiated but also implausible.

https://healthfeedback.org/claimreview/evidence-points-to-coronavirus-sars-cov-2-being-of-natural-origin-no-evidence-it-could-have-been-intentionally-propagated/

Claim: “Coronavirus: Florida man arrested for robbery using cough as a weapon.”
Explaination: This screenshot of “breaking news” is originally from a satirical news site. If you look closely, you'll see a news generator watermark in the top right corner, meaning the image was created.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: “Coronavirus: Florida man arrested for robbery using cough as a weapon.”

Explanation:This screenshot of “breaking news” is originally from a satirical news site. If you look closely, you'll see a news generator watermark in the top right corner, meaning the image was created.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/feb/28/facebook-posts/no-coronavirus-disease-was-not-used-weapon-robbery/
ann25_remarks: Robbery is certainly civil disobedience...but I am not confident it should fit in here...perhaps none of the above.

Claim: ICMR issued a report claiming the number of people infected with thte coronavirus increased up to 8 Lakh if india did not announce a lockdown.
Explaination: ICMR did not publish any such report about the possible numbers of COVID-19 infected people.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: ICMR issued a report claiming the number of people infected with thte coronavirus increased up to 8 Lakh if india did not announce a lockdown.

Explanation:ICMR did not publish any such report about the possible numbers of COVID-19 infected people.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/dsdrss/permalink/3346344562098279/

Claim: WalMart reducing hours of operation.
Explaination: WalMart website confirms
Label: FALSE

Claim: WalMart reducing hours of operation.

Explanation:WalMart website confirms

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471943-Fact-Check-Walmart-IS-Cutting-Hours-Across-Country-Amid-Coronavirus-Outbreak.html

Claim: Coronavirus life span in a single place is 8 hours, and the Janata Curfew in India is for 14 hours. Thanks to 12 hours of Janata Curfew, the virus will be killed.

Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Coronavirus life span in a single place is 8 hours, and the Janata Curfew in India is for 14 hours. Thanks to 12 hours of Janata Curfew, the virus will be killed.

Explanation:Social Distancing Is Important; But Viral Post Claiming 14-Hr Break Will Kill COVID-19 Is Misleading.

Claim: This map shows the global spread of COVID-19.
Explaination: This map shows flight paths worldwide -- it does not show the movement of Wuhan residents.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: This map shows the global spread of COVID-19.

Explanation:This map shows flight paths worldwide -- it does not show the movement of Wuhan residents.

https://factcheck.afp.com/map-shows-flight-paths-worldwide-it-does-not-show-movement-wuhan-residents

Claim: “So let me get this straight about this virus. It’s ‘new’ yet it was lab created and patented in 2015 (in development since 03’).”
Explaination: All of the posts link to patents that are related to two different viruses in the coronavirus family. There is no patent related to the new virus
Label: (Org. doesn't apply rating)
html:
Claim: “So let me get this straight about this virus. It’s ‘new’ yet it was lab created and patented in 2015 (in development since 03’).”

Explanation:All of the posts link to patents that are related to two different viruses in the coronavirus family. There is no patent related to the new virus

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/01/social-media-posts-spread-bogus-coronavirus-conspiracy-theory?check=2

Claim: Purported advisories urging residents to stay indoors while national air force helicopters spray disinfectant over homes to kill off the novel coronavirus have been circulated online in Sri Lanka and the Philippines.
Explaination: But the claim is false; both the Sri Lankan and Philippine governments said their air forces were not involved in any such operations.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Purported advisories urging residents to stay indoors while national air force helicopters spray disinfectant over homes to kill off the novel coronavirus have been circulated online in Sri Lanka and the Philippines.

Explanation:But the claim is false; both the Sri Lankan and Philippine governments said their air forces were not involved in any such operations.

https://factcheck.afp.com/false-claim-circulates-online-certain-countries-asia-are-using-helicopters-spray-covid-19

Claim: List comparing diseases with coronavirus.
Explaination: The comparison of the outbreaks is extremely misleading as it doesn't take into account the rate of infections, timeframes of the outbreaks and the rapid rise in the number of COVID-19 cases.
Label: False
html:
Claim: List comparing diseases with coronavirus.

Explanation:The comparison of the outbreaks is extremely misleading as it doesn't take into account the rate of infections, timeframes of the outbreaks and the rapid rise in the number of COVID-19 cases.

Claim: Chlorine dioxide kits sold online under various “MMS” names — Miracle Mineral Solution, Miracle Mineral Supplement, Master Mineral Solution — will cure the coronavirus.
Explaination: MMS does not "cure" coronavirus and can be dangerous to your health.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chlorine dioxide kits sold online under various “MMS” names — Miracle Mineral Solution, Miracle Mineral Supplement, Master Mineral Solution — will cure the coronavirus.

Explanation:MMS does not "cure" coronavirus and can be dangerous to your health.

Claim: “NYC man drops dead in middle of street — suspected coronavirus!”
Explaination: New York City Police say a man was taken to the hospital after falling and hitting his head. He was in stable condition and it was unrelated to coronavirus, according to police.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “NYC man drops dead in middle of street — suspected coronavirus!”

Explanation:New York City Police say a man was taken to the hospital after falling and hitting his head. He was in stable condition and it was unrelated to coronavirus, according to police.

Claim: People will not be allowed to organize a funeral for any family members who die of COVID-19. Instead, the state will take care of the disposal of the body.
Explaination: The rules around funerals have changed as gatherings are currently not allowed, but families are still allowed to look after funeral services for their loved ones without the involvement of the State.
Label: False
html:
Claim: People will not be allowed to organize a funeral for any family members who die of COVID-19. Instead, the state will take care of the disposal of the body.

Explanation:The rules around funerals have changed as gatherings are currently not allowed, but families are still allowed to look after funeral services for their loved ones without the involvement of the State.

https://jrnl.ie/5057356

Claim: Janta curfew in India will help break the chain of transmission.
Explaination: The World Health Organisation has maintained that it is not certain how long the virus that causes COVID-19 survives on surfaces, but it seems to behave like other coronaviruses.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Janta curfew in India will help break the chain of transmission.

Explanation:The World Health Organisation has maintained that it is not certain how long the virus that causes COVID-19 survives on surfaces, but it seems to behave like other coronaviruses.

https://fit.thequint.com/fit-webqoof/fit-webqoof-janta-curfew-of-one-day-will-not-free-india-of-coronavirus

Claim: “President Trump, COVID-19 coronavirus: U.S. cases 1,329; U.S. deaths, 38; panic level: mass hysteria. President Obama, H1N1 virus: U.S. cases, 60.8 million; U.S. deaths, 12,469; panic level: totally chill. Do you all see how the media can manipulate your life.”
Explaination: Numbers that suggest H1N1 was worse than COVID-19 are misleading. It’s too early to calculate how deadly the coronavirus will be, but there are signs it’s much worse.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: “President Trump, COVID-19 coronavirus: U.S. cases 1,329; U.S. deaths, 38; panic level: mass hysteria. President Obama, H1N1 virus: U.S. cases, 60.8 million; U.S. deaths, 12,469; panic level: totally chill. Do you all see how the media can manipulate your life.”

Explanation:Numbers that suggest H1N1 was worse than COVID-19 are misleading. It’s too early to calculate how deadly the coronavirus will be, but there are signs it’s much worse.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/18/viral-image/numbers-suggesting-h1n1-worse-covid-19-are-mislead/

Claim: Garlic water can cure novel coronavirus.
Explaination: Garlic is a healthy food that may have some antimicrobial properties. However, there is no evidence from the current outbreak that eating garlic has protected people from the new coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Garlic water can cure novel coronavirus.

Explanation:Garlic is a healthy food that may have some antimicrobial properties. However, there is no evidence from the current outbreak that eating garlic has protected people from the new coronavirus.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-post-claiming-garlic-water-can-cure-novel-coronavirus-is-fake/

Claim: In Japan, Okinawa Prefecture Governor Tamaki Denny was seen Kachashi dancing with the mayor of Nanjo City. It was reported that “the governor and the mayor danced while the people were terrified about the new coronavirus infection.”
Explaination: It is true that Governor Tamaki danced Kachashi with Mayor Zukeran in January 25. But this is before a cruise ship anchored in Naha.
Label: False
html:
Claim: In Japan, Okinawa Prefecture Governor Tamaki Denny was seen Kachashi dancing with the mayor of Nanjo City. It was reported that “the governor and the mayor danced while the people were terrified about the new coronavirus infection.”

Explanation:It is true that Governor Tamaki danced Kachashi with Mayor Zukeran in January 25. But this is before a cruise ship anchored in Naha.

https://www.buzzfeed.com/jp/kensukeseya/okinawa-korona-1

Claim: Indian PM Modi announced a lockdown extension until 5/4/20 in India.
Explaination: No such announcement was made by PM Modi, the image is digitally edited.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Indian PM Modi announced a lockdown extension until 5/4/20 in India.

Explanation:No such announcement was made by PM Modi, the image is digitally edited.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/02/pm-modi-has-announced-extension-of-nationwide-lockdown-till-4-may-2020/?check=1

Claim: Ugandan president announces the postponement of elections.
Explaination: The claim is false; an electoral commission official issued a flat denial, labelling the claim “nonsensical”.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Ugandan president announces the postponement of elections.

Explanation:The claim is false; an electoral commission official issued a flat denial, labelling the claim “nonsensical”.

https://factcheck.afp.com/ugandan-president-has-not-announced-elections-postponement-officials-dismiss-claim

Claim: Staff of two Mumbai hotels have COVID-positive cases.
Explaination: Both the hotels denied having any such cases.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Staff of two Mumbai hotels have COVID-positive cases.

Explanation:Both the hotels denied having any such cases.

https://www.boomlive.in/health/coronavirus-rumours-hit-mumbai-hotels-westin-and-fatty-bao-7246

Claim: Riots in London due to the unavailability of food items. The United Kingdom will be locked down by tonight. Army soldiers take to the UK streets.
Explaination: The video is not related to coronavirus but with London riots that happened in 2011. The 2011 England riots, more widely known as the London Riots, were a series of riots between 6 and 11 August 2011, when thousands of people rioted in cities and towns across England, saw looting, arson, and mass deployment of police, and resulted in the deaths of five people.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Riots in London due to the unavailability of food items. The United Kingdom will be locked down by tonight. Army soldiers take to the UK streets.

Explanation:The video is not related to coronavirus but with London riots that happened in 2011. The 2011 England riots, more widely known as the London Riots, were a series of riots between 6 and 11 August 2011, when thousands of people rioted in cities and towns across England, saw looting, arson, and mass deployment of police, and resulted in the deaths of five people.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15320709

Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: False

ann25_remarks: It is not clear what is wrong with this claim.  Plus I don't speak Spanish

Claim: A lengthy post purportedly contains advice on how to prevent infection from the novel coronavirus. The post claims the advice was issued by a UK hospital to its medical staff.
Explaination: The claim is false; the hospital named in the misleading Facebook posts denied issuing the guidelines; the posts also contained several false claims previously debunked by AFP Fact Check.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A lengthy post purportedly contains advice on how to prevent infection from the novel coronavirus. The post claims the advice was issued by a UK hospital to its medical staff.

Explanation:The claim is false; the hospital named in the misleading Facebook posts denied issuing the guidelines; the posts also contained several false claims previously debunked by AFP Fact Check.

https://factcheck.afp.com/hoax-circulates-uk-hospital-has-issued-special-advice-staff-prevent-covid-19-infection

Claim: An image of a couple claimed to be doctors who have lost their lives to the coronavirus.
Explaination: The picture is an AFP picture of a couple at the Barcelona airport after US President Donald Trump informed that US was banning travel from the EU.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An image of a couple claimed to be doctors who have lost their lives to the coronavirus.

Explanation:The picture is an AFP picture of a couple at the Barcelona airport after US President Donald Trump informed that US was banning travel from the EU.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/covid-19-couple-photographed-at-spain-airport-shared-as-deceased-italian-doctors-7362

Claim: U.S. President Donald Trump said in a White House briefing on 3/20/20 that chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, which are often used to treat malaria, have been approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for treatment of COVID-19.
Explaination: Chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine is FDA-approved for treating malaria, lupus, and rheumatoid arthritis, but not COVID-19. There is no official cure for the disease as of March 25.
Label: Partially false
html:
Claim: U.S. President Donald Trump said in a White House briefing on 3/20/20 that chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, which are often used to treat malaria, have been approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for treatment of COVID-19.

Explanation:Chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine is FDA-approved for treating malaria, lupus, and rheumatoid arthritis, but not COVID-19. There is no official cure for the disease as of March 25.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/255701-us-fda-approves-hydroxychloroquine-covid-19-treatment
ann25_remarks: Public authority, medical advice, prominent actors, and medical treatments...overlaps with 4 categories

Claim: Image claims that dead bodies from Italy are kept in a room.
Explaination: The image is from a Cairo Mosque which was turned into a makeshift morgue in 2013.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Image claims that dead bodies from Italy are kept in a room.

Explanation:The image is from a Cairo Mosque which was turned into a makeshift morgue in 2013.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/21/fact-check-scene-from-a-cairo-mosque-turned-into-a-morgue-in-2013-misinterpreted-as-deaths-from-italy/

Claim: Pakistani doctor Osama Riaz’s last message for you (while taking his last breath).
Explaination: The video is not of the Pakistani doctor who died but of another doctor from the UK who tested positive and is going to be discharged soon.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Pakistani doctor Osama Riaz’s last message for you (while taking his last breath).

Explanation:The video is not of the Pakistani doctor who died but of another doctor from the UK who tested positive and is going to be discharged soon.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/no-this-is-not-the-last-message-of-deceased-pakistani-doctor-osama-riaz-7359
ann25_remarks: Either this category or Cannot Determine

Claim: Multiple posts shared hundreds of times on Facebook and Twitter in March 2020 claim a new vaccine and a new drug have been developed to prevent and treat the novel coronavirus. The posts claim the developments were made by scientists in Japan and the Philippines respectively.
Explaination: The claims are misleading; the Japanese government announced in late March 2020 that Japanese scientists were testing a new drug, not a vaccine, to treat COVID-19; the Philippine Food and Drug Administration warned the other drug cited in the misleading posts was "unregistered" and not safe.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Multiple posts shared hundreds of times on Facebook and Twitter in March 2020 claim a new vaccine and a new drug have been developed to prevent and treat the novel coronavirus. The posts claim the developments were made by scientists in Japan and the Philippines respectively.

Explanation:The claims are misleading; the Japanese government announced in late March 2020 that Japanese scientists were testing a new drug, not a vaccine, to treat COVID-19; the Philippine Food and Drug Administration warned the other drug cited in the misleading posts was "unregistered" and not safe.

https://factcheck.afp.com/new-misinformation-circulates-online-asia-about-creation-vaccine-and-drug-covid-19?fbclid=IwAR3ZkV_A-JcfvQjdu8rDDxfD6Bsyd9zHJdMMk3dC9BnHzIa43J5XrtJoUv8

Claim: This video shows a man eating a bat soup in a restaurant in China.
Explaination: With identified many elements in the video that matched pictures published by Chinese bloggers who visited Palau and documented their trip.
Label: False
html:
Claim: This video shows a man eating a bat soup in a restaurant in China.

Explanation:With identified many elements in the video that matched pictures published by Chinese bloggers who visited Palau and documented their trip.

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200130-intox-chine-soupe-chauve-souris-rumeur-origine-coronavirus?check=4

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/?check=8

Claim: In Sri Lanka, Sathosa Supermarket trucks bearing the image of former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa are being used to distribute food during current COVID-19 curfew. Text condemns the act by mentioning how ethical is it to carry out such acts during this difficult time and gain political advantage.
Explaination: 2014 Images of Sathosa Lorries with PM Mahinda Rajapaksha portrayed as recent vehicles used to distribute food during curfew. Newspaper which carried original image published a disclaimer.
Label: False
html:
Claim: In Sri Lanka, Sathosa Supermarket trucks bearing the image of former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa are being used to distribute food during current COVID-19 curfew. Text condemns the act by mentioning how ethical is it to carry out such acts during this difficult time and gain political advantage.

Explanation:2014 Images of Sathosa Lorries with PM Mahinda Rajapaksha portrayed as recent vehicles used to distribute food during curfew. Newspaper which carried original image published a disclaimer.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/26/fact-check-2014-images-of-sathosa-lorries-with-pm-mahinda-rajapaksha-portrayed-as-vehicles-used-to-distribute-food-during-curfew-amid-covid19/

Claim: IPhoto shows people falling dead on Italian streets from COVID-19.
Explaination: This was a stolen photo originally dating back to 2014 for a Holocaust remembrance project.
Label: False
html:
Claim: IPhoto shows people falling dead on Italian streets from COVID-19.

Explanation:This was a stolen photo originally dating back to 2014 for a Holocaust remembrance project.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/Fact-Check-Photo-Does-NOT-Show-People-Falling-Dead-On-Italy's-Streets.html

Claim: High-rise buildings have become human incinerators to combat the spread of the coronavirus.
Explaination: There was no concrete evidence to prove that buildings were being burned to stop coronavirus. The Twitter authority cited in the story was not credible.
Label: False
html:
Claim: High-rise buildings have become human incinerators to combat the spread of the coronavirus.

Explanation:There was no concrete evidence to prove that buildings were being burned to stop coronavirus. The Twitter authority cited in the story was not credible.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471673-fake-news-no-proof-that-high-rise-buildings-have-become-human-incinerators-to-combat-coronavirus.html

Claim: A photograph that shows people on the floor demonstrates the impact of the new coronavirus in China.
Explaination: The claim along with the photo is false and it is in no way related to the outbreak of coronavirus. It is actually an old photo from Germany dated to 2014. Moreover, the people in the photo are not dead, but were lying down on the road as part of an art project.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photograph that shows people on the floor demonstrates the impact of the new coronavirus in China.

Explanation:The claim along with the photo is false and it is in no way related to the outbreak of coronavirus. It is actually an old photo from Germany dated to 2014. Moreover, the people in the photo are not dead, but were lying down on the road as part of an art project.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/photo-of-people-lying-dead-on-a-street-due-to-coronavirus-fact-check

Claim: A video shows bats, the main source of the coronavirus, on many roofs in Hubei district.
Explaination: The video is an 8 year old video from Miami Florida and is not linked to the coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows bats, the main source of the coronavirus, on many roofs in Hubei district.

Explanation:The video is an 8 year old video from Miami Florida and is not linked to the coronavirus.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/bat-infestation-video-from-florida-falsely-shared-as-coronavirus-source-found-6747

Claim: Coronavirus was created in a lab in Wuhan.
Explaination: No scientific evidence exists to assert that the coronavirus was created in a lab. According to the WHO, “Both Chinese and external expert groups are working in trying to identify the animal source of this new virus.”
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Coronavirus was created in a lab in Wuhan.

Explanation:No scientific evidence exists to assert that the coronavirus was created in a lab. According to the WHO, “Both Chinese and external expert groups are working in trying to identify the animal source of this new virus.”

https://fit.thequint.com/fit-webqoof/fit-webqoof-did-china-create-the-wuhan-coronavirus-in-its-lab-fact-check
